page.title: 04 50 YEARS AT GREAT PARK FARM
page.content: Mr. Binning first came to the farm in 1927.Since 1927 2 other local farms have been taken over,making about 600 hectares in all. In 1927 EMPLOYMENT on the farm was 24 full-time workers,today there are only 6.Much less labour is needed now because of mechanisation. MACHINERY has made the work much easier,yet wages are much higher (60-75p in 1927 and now over 100 pounds). FARMING is bigger business now with more paperwork making an office and secretary necessary. All lambing takes place indoors and the shepard can keep watch from home using a video. Today they do not produce any poultry and less beef cattle because they are less PROFITABLE.(Sarah Blythe,Grace Squibb,Christine Eddy)
